column4: the website/app is engaged in a “sale” under the CCPA if the third parties have some ability to use
column5: disclose or retain the data to improve their service or to take steps beyond the most narrowly drawn bounds of merely providing their service to the website/app.

column2: and in most cases merely provides the third party with an opportunity to collect data directly
column3: instead of sending a copy of personal information to the third party.

CALIFORNIA CONSUMER PRIVACY STATEMENTThis California Consumer Privacy Statement (“Statement”) supplements the Consumer Services Privacy Policy.
It applies solely to California consumers that use or interact with our Consumer Services.
This Statement uses certain terms that have the meaning given to them in the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 and its implementing regulations (the “CCPA”).1.

column1: California Consumer Privacy RightsYou have certain choices regarding your personal information
column2: as described below.

column1: Access: You have the right to request
column2: twice in a 12-month period
column3: that we disclose to you the personal information we have collected

column1: Deletion: You have the right to request that we delete certain personal information we have collected from you.
Opt-Out of Sale: You have the right to opt-out of the sale of your personal information.
How to Submit a Request. To submit an access or deletion request
column2: please log into your Foursquare account or call us at (855)-505-8916.

column1: To opt-out of the sale of your personal information
column2: click here or email us at privacy@foursquare.com.

column1: You must provide us with your device identifier
column2: which we will use to fulfill your opt-out request.

column1: If you do not know your device identifier
column2: below are instructions on how to locate it.

column1: We will not use the information you provide as part of your request for any purpose other than to fulfill your opt-out request.
If you use an iOS operating system
column2: a third-party application is required to locate your Apple IDFA.

column1: Please note that we do not control such third-party tools and are not responsible for their content
column2: their privacy policies
column3: or their use of your personal information.

column1: If you use an Android operating system
column2: open the Google Settings app on your Android device and select “Ads.” Your Advertising Identifier should be listed at the bottom of the screen.

column1: To submit a request as an authorized agent on behalf of a consumer
column2: please send us a notarized power of attorney and/or other legal documentation.

column1: Requests from agents that do not submit sufficient proof that they have been authorized by you to act on your behalf will be denied.
For questions or concerns about our privacy policies and practices
column2: please contact us as described in the “Contact Us” section of our Enterprise Services Privacy Policy.

column1: Verifying Requests. To help protect your privacy and maintain security
column2: we will take steps to verify your identity before granting you access to your personal information or complying with your request.

column1: If you have an account with us
column2: we are unable to fulfill your access or deletion requests at this time because there is no reasonable method by which we can verify your identity to the level of certainty required by California law.

column1: The reason for this is that Foursquare historically has not linked IP addresses
column2: device identifiers or other information collected through automated means to named actual persons unless the individual uses the Consumer Services.

column1: Additional Information. If you choose to exercise any of your rights under the CCPA
column2: you have the right to not receive discriminatory treatment by us.

column1: To the extent permitted by applicable law
column2: we may charge a reasonable fee to comply with your request.

440^Transparency^Details are provided about what kind of information they collect^"What are your thoughts on internet privacy?
Big internet companies like Facebook or Google have effectively hijacked the privacy discourse in the recent years.
Their marketers managed to convince the public that the most important things about privacy are superficial tools that allow hiding your public posts from the people around you.
Adding these superficial tools enables companies to calm down the public and change nothing in how they are turning over private data to marketers and other third parties.
At Telegram we think that the two most important components of Internet privacy should be instead:
Protecting your private conversations from snooping third parties
column2: such as officials

column1: Protecting your personal data from third parties
column2: such as marketers

column1: This is what everybody should care about
column2: and these are some of our top priorities."^332

column1: Q: A bot or channel is infringing on my copyright.
What do I do?
All Telegram chats and group chats are private amongst their participants.
We do not process any requests related to them.
But sticker sets
column2: channels
column3: and bots on Telegram are publicly available.

column1: If you see a bot
column2: channel
column3: or sticker set that is infringing on your copyright
column4: kindly submit a complaint to dmca@telegram.org.

column1: Please note that such requests should only be submitted by the copyright owner or an agent authorized to act on the owner’s behalf.
Q: Wait! 0_o Do you process take-down requests from third parties?
Our mission is to provide a secure means of communication that works everywhere on the planet.
To do this in the places where it is most needed (and to continue distributing Telegram through the App Store and Google Play)
column2: we have to process legitimate requests to take down illegal public content (e.g.

column1: For example
column2: we can take down sticker sets that violate intellectual property rights or porn bots.

column1: User-uploaded stickers sets
column2: channels
column3: and bots by third-party developers are not part of the core Telegram UI.

column1: Whenever we receive a complaint at abuse@telegram.org or dmca@telegram.org regarding the legality of public content
column2: we perform the necessary legal checks and take it down when deemed appropriate.

column1: Please note that this does not apply to local restrictions on freedom of speech.
For example
column2: if criticizing the government is illegal in some country
column3: Telegram won't be a part of such politically motivated censorship.

column1: This goes against our founders' principles.
While we do block terrorist (e.g.
ISIS-related) bots and channels
column2: we will not block anybody who peacefully expresses alternative opinions"^310

column4: each item is encrypted with a separate key

column1: This key and the file’s location are then encrypted again
column2: this time with the secret chat’s key — and sent to your recipient.

column1: They can then download and decipher the file.
This means that the file is technically on one of Telegram’s servers
column2: but it looks like a piece of random indecipherable garbage to everyone except for you and the recipient.

column1: We don’t know what this random data stands for and we have no idea which particular chat it belongs to.
We periodically purge this random data from our servers to save disk space.

Our websites are hosted by third party service providers and therefore any personal details you submit through them may be processed by that third party service provider.
We also use other third parties to process your personal details including in the following areas:
to action all online expressions of interest to join Amnesty International or take actions and manage all related communications
to process online payments
to process all information associated with applications for employment or volunteering opportunities and related recruitment processes.
All third party services providers process your personal information only on Amnesty International Limited's behalf and are bound by contractual terms that are compliant with data protection law.
We participate in Facebook’s custom audience and lookalike audience programs
